 You don't have to buy it as a primary motivator. Just remember that Saddam was the first ME oil producer to accept Euros as oil tender, a dangerous trend now expanding with the expected USD devaluation, and Iraq direct cost, $150-billion of budgeted and supplementry funding, is about 1.5% of annual GDP without domestic flow-through. Add flow-through (pick a multiplier, anything from 2X up will do it) in our internal transaction payment imbalance economy and you're right at projected annual GDP growth. Subtract the debt required for deficit spending and you'll end up with negative GDP growth.
